trial_identification.studytitle: Assessment and prevention of falls, functional decline and hospital re-admission in older adults post-hospitalisation
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of DVD exercise program compared to usual care for reducing falls, functional decline and hospital re-admissions amongst older adults post-hospitalisation

conditions.healthcondition: Prevention of falls, functional decline and hospital re-admission in older adults post hospitalisation

interventions.interventions: INTERVENTION: Self-progressed home exercise program in DVD and booklet format, to be completed at least 3 times per week. Each session will be 30 minutes. The program will include exercises to address balance, hip control, weight shift, lower limb strength and endurance, and components of walking. Participants are to complete the exercise program no more than 7 times per week. The participants will be actively monitored and encouraged to participate for 8 weeks, followed by a 18 week period without active encouragement.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Mean 5 dimensional EuroQol with visual analogue scale (EQ-5D & VAS) form
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At discharge, 7 weeks, 2 months, and 6 months
At discharge, self recording of all falls for 6 months and then monthly phone calls for 6 months
At discharge, 7 weeks, 2 months and 6 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Balance outcome measure for elder rehabilitation.
Gaitrite: velocity, cadence and double limb support

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Use a gait aid to mobilise-discharged from hospital to a community dwelling- Not referred for post-discharge community rehabilitation services.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Unstable severe cardiac disease- Cognitive impairment (Mini-Mental State Examination [MMSE] < 23)- Aggressive behaviour- Restricted weight-bearing status.

trial_design.concealment: Patients being discharged from hospital will be approached for consent. Allocation via sequential opening of opaque envelopes containing computer generated random number sequence
trial_design.sequence: Computer generated random number sequence by investigator not involved in recruitment or assessment.
trial_design.designfeatures: The follow-up assessor is blinded to the participant's group allocation

fundingsource.fundingname: Queensland Health Allied Health Community Rehabilitation Scheme

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study aims to evaluate the effectiveness of a video exercise program for preventing falls, functional decline, and hospital re-admission amongst older adults who walk with a walking aid and have recently been discharged from hospital.
